channel.title: [317]Delta/Devo-New Problem[317] Will Rep++!
channel.description:
Ok, I don't exactly know how to search for this, so I decided to post.
On real RS, when you are not a member you cannot level certain skills. I would like to make "Classes" on my server, These classes consist of "Ranger", "Weapon Master", "Wizard", "Skiller", and "All". I know how to do this, but my question is, how do I add it so that they cannot level certain skills? For example I want a Skiller to be unable to level up Attack. Help Please?

item.title: [317]Delta/Devo-New Problem[317] Will Rep++!
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

It’s because of the way you’ve written your if statements. You should put brackets around certain things. For example, you have:

This basically means that it checks to see if any of the following is true:

  • Player’s class is 2 and skill trained is 4
  • Skill trained is 6
  • Skill trained is 7
  • Skill trained is 8
    …and so on.
    If any of those conditions are met, XP is not given. I’m making an obvious guess that you want the checks to be a bit more like:
  • Player’s class is 2 and skill trained is 4
  • Player’s class is 2 and skill trained is 6
  • Player’s class is 2 and skill trained is 7
  • Player’s class is 2 and skill trained is 8

To do that, you should add brackets like so:

Alternatively, you can use a nested if statement:

if(classes == 2) { if(skill == 4 || skill == 6 || skill == 7 || skill == 8 || ...) { return false; } }

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Delta/Devo-New Problem[317] Will Rep++!
item.dc:creator: @Danielplanto Danielplanto
item.description:
@Danielplanto wrote:

Ok, New problem, I am testing it, and I choose melee, it works (melee = class 2) but for some reason str wont level! Can some1 help?

    if(classes == 2 && skill == 4 ||  skill == 6 ||  skill == 7 ||  skill == 8 ||  skill == 9 ||  skill == 10 ||  skill == 11 ||  skill == 12 ||  skill == 13 ||  skill == 14 ||  skill == 15 ||  skill == 16 ||  skill == 17 ||  skill == 18 ||  skill == 19 ||  skill == 20){
    return false;
    }
    if(classes == 3 && skill == 0 ||  skill == 2 ||  skill == 6 ||  skill == 7 ||  skill == 8 ||  skill == 9 ||  skill == 10 ||  skill == 11 ||  skill == 12 ||  skill == 13 ||  skill == 14 ||  skill == 15 ||  skill == 16 ||  skill == 17 ||  skill == 18 ||  skill == 19 ||  skill == 20){
    return false;
    }
    if(classes == 4 && skill == 0 ||  skill == 2 ||  skill == 4 ||  skill == 7 ||  skill == 8 ||  skill == 9 ||  skill == 10 ||  skill == 11 ||  skill == 12 ||  skill == 13 ||  skill == 14 ||  skill == 15 ||  skill == 16 ||  skill == 17 ||  skill == 18 ||  skill == 19 ||  skill == 20){
    return false;
    } 
    if(classes == 5 && skill == 0 ||  skill == 2 ||  skill == 3 ||  skill == 4 ||  skill == 5 ||  skill == 6){
    return false;
    }

Ok, discovered another problem. This is the classes order:

1 = All
2 = Melee
3 = Ranger
4 = Mage
5 = Skiller

Ive tested melee and Ranger, melee, str wnt level, ranger RANGE/prayer wont level!

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Delta/Devo-New Problem[317] Will Rep++!
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

Whenever a player gains XP in Delta, is uses the method:

So, in that method just add some restrictions, for example:

if(class == 1 && skill == 2) { return false; }
So let’s say class is your variable that contains what class the player is (Wizard, Ranger, etc.) and that 1 would be a Ranger. Skill index 2 is Strength. So, if a player was a Ranger, they wouldn’t be able to gain any XP in Strength.

Read full topic
